fields.description:
The class should not be called LocalAgentManagerImpl but just AgentManagerImpl (same goes for the interface). For backward compatibility, we can use inheritance.
Also, since the bean is transactional, it should not publish events.
fields.summary: Refactoring around LocalAgentManagerImpl

fields.description:
I receive quite a few mails from different Bamboo servers, regarding different projects.
It's very hard to write reliable email rules to sort them out, esp for gmail.

My life would be much easier here if Bamboo would just add some custom email headers:
- server id (From field is useless: Random User Name <noreply@mydomain.com>)
- plan id (so I don't have to stress my regexp skills)
- event type (to distinguish failed builds from important ones)
fields.summary: Please add some kludges to emails sent from Bamboo
Export a specific Plan as XML

fields.description:
I'm passing an argument with a space to a Maven build (-Dsqlcmd.auth="-U sa -P xxxxxxxx"). Bamboo is tokenizing it correctly as a single argument, but Maven sees it as separate arguments and fails:

> [WARNING]
> Profile with id: 'xxxxxxxx' has not been activated.
...
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[ERROR] BUILD FAILURE
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[INFO] Invalid task 'sa': you must specify a valid lifecycle phase, or a goal in the format plugin:goal or pluginGroupId:pluginArtifactId:pluginVersion:goal
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> build	11-Jul-2011 20:37:51	[INFO] For more information, run Maven with the -e switch

Suggesting that Maven's seeing 'sa', '-P' and 'xxxxxxxx' as separate arguments.
fields.summary: Maven arguments with spaces confuse Windows build agents
Race condition can create duplicate plan keys, causing Bamboo to fail to start

fields.description:
as an effect - after restart Bamboo doesn't start properly - missing atlassian-user.xml file.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Setup new Bamboo
2. During setup import data 
3. Bamboo works fine
4. Stop Bamboo
5. Start Bamboo - doesn't start because of error

Example export file: export_atlassianbamboo_2509_20110629_2.zip

Of course, adding atlassian-user.xml into bamboo_home/xml-data/configuration fixes the problem.
I use this content:

{code}
<atlassian-user>
 <repositories>
 <hibernate name="Hibernate Repository" key="hibernateRepository" description="Hibernate Repository" cache="true"/>
 </repositories>
</atlassian-user>
{code}

fields.description:
The bundled svnkit.jar (svnkit-1.3.5.7539.jar) is having issues connecting to a Subversion repository that uses digest authentication. I've gone through http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Authentication+Failure+with+NTLM+Subversion+Authentication, but we don't have control on the repository we are hitting, so we couldn't enable basic authentication.

So, I decided to try replacing the bundled svnkit.jar with the latest standalone version from svnkit's website (svnkit-1.3.5.7406.jar) and authentication works without any special system properties. Although this is ultimately a bug in the svnkit's code base (I assume), you can fix this by reconsidering the version/revision jar being used.

Note: Only tested this on 3.0.3, but looked at the bundled jar with the 3.1.4 code in webapp/WEB-INF/lib and saw the same titled jar, so I'm assuming it has been unchanged between version 3.0.3 and 3.1.4.
fields.summary: SVNKit bundled cannot authenticate against Digest Authentication (Apache)

fields.description:
It's not possible to currently write a gadget in a Bamboo plugin for consumption in JIRA (or other gadget containers).

The problem is that the REST resource that serves up the gadget returns a 500 error to logged out users (despite that REST Resource specifying AnonymousAllowed).

For example if you request https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets.build-plan-hack/status/planStatusWithBreakers.xml you get a 500 error when you are logged out.  

When shindig (from say JIRA) attempts to request the gadget XML it does not use authentication since the gadget XML is just a static XML resource that doesn't contain any data.  

It seems that Bamboo has a whitelist implemented that allows REST requests for gadgets with the package com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets (to make the gadgets shipped with Bamboo work).  However this approach doesn't work if you write your own Bamboo plugin because you can't deploy 2 plugins with the same key!
fields.summary: Can't write Bamboo gadget in a Bamboo plugin

fields.description:
I have a c++ project (cmake based) where I want the following steps to be executed:
Configure -> Build -> Test -> Package -> Distribute
I want to alter the configure task so that I can run against different compilers or with different compiler flags. The only way to do it with Bamboo is to duplicate the plan. This means that next time I want to modify my plan, I will have to modify X plans instead of just 1. This is just not possible given the number of configurations we need to test. 

What we would need is "plan templates", ie. a way to define a plan containing parameters. We would then define plans based on the template and just defining the parameters. Any change to the plan template would be immediately seen in the plans based on the template.
fields.summary: Allow running the same plan with different parameters (ie. plans templates)

fields.description:
We are willing to move from Hudson to Bamboo but it seems impossible with the latter to say "run this plan on the agents A1, A2 and A3". This is absolutely necessary to test our tool on various platforms and OS. 
The only solution is to clone the plan and tweak the requirements and capabilities of agents and jobs to force the plan P1 to run on A1, P2 on A2, ... This is extremely inconvenient. Moreover, next time we want to modify our plan, we will have to modify 3 plans (in this example, but 30 in our system) instead of just one. 

Without this feature, we just can't move to bamboo.
fields.summary: Run a plan on several agents

fields.description:
Bamboo's shift from have many plans to many jobs within a smaller number of plans is a nice one. However, it reduces the effectiveness of Bamboo's built in wallboard support.

For example: https://studio.atlassian.com/builds/telemetry.action?filter=project&projectKey=STRM

We used to have a ton of plans, one plan per project per streams version. This morning we reorganized it into one plan per streams version, and then one job per product within each plan.
But we still want to see each individual (or better yet, each favorited) job on the wallboard instead of the parent plans.

We don't see any way to favorite specific jobs right now so we figure this can't yet be done.
fields.summary: Make Bamboo wallboard more job friendly

fields.description:
Currently in Bamboo, if you run selenium html tests or Fitness tests, you get back an html result file. There is no way in Bamboo to display this - other than by saving it as an artifact and viewing the artifact.

It would be nice if in Bamboo, like in CC.net and other CI servers (TeamCity,etc) you could configure Bamboo to use the result file in a tab so that results like this could be displayed much like jUnit results are currently displayed.
fields.summary: Ability to allow bamboo to display html or xml results

fields.description:
The help icon in the Schedule Editor leads to a Confluence page that does not exist.

Steps to reproduce:

* Edit a build plan
* Switch to "Source Repository" settings tab
* Change "Build Strategy" to "Cron Based Scheduling"
* Edit the cron schedule below to open the "Schudule Editor" dialog window.
* Click the "help" icon

Change the "not run" icon in manual stages

fields.description:
If someone is testing a custom task they only have the option of deleting the task if they do not want to run that task.

As a build engineer, I'd like to be able to disable and enable tasks so that I do not have to delete important config info, or for the inline script example, copy paste the contents elsewhere.

Thanks
Bryce
fields.summary: Tasks should have the ability to be enabled and disabled
Try to inline adding project links in ViewProject screen

As suggested here: https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-3168#c54379

Some interfaces would stay in bamboo-api, because we don't want to make bamboo-api dependent on bamboo-jira
fields.summary: Move Jira related code to a separate module in the project

fields.description: Bamboo uses Crowd's crowd-integration-atlassian-user-1 (as part of crowd-integration-client) to connect to Crowd. Work to enable dynamic configuration has meant a number of changes here that needed full releases of Crowd to make it available to Bamboo. The module should be moved into Bamboo and used directly, depending on release versions of Crowd for the client libraries.

fields.description: When using something like Bandana or Active Objects in a plugin, we often use the id as our reference rather than the key.  For plugins to be able to delete their own data on when Bamboo data gets deleted they will need to know the id of the object that was deleted.
fields.summary: Deletion Events should also contain the id of the object being deleted

fields.description:
Since using the Windows EC2 instances, I've noticed that instances would fail to start. I believe the root cause of the problem is related to EC2, however, Bamboo can be
improved to handle this situation more gracefully, as it will result in customers paying for EC2 costs that they don't use

Symptoms:
* Elastic instance has been started for a long period of time, yet the elastic agent is still in the pending state

* You are unable to remote desktop into the instance

* Running System Log in the EC2 console results in a non-response

Recommendation: Shutdown the elastic instance if the agent is stuck in the PENDING state for a long period of time (15 minutes?)
fields.summary: Handle Elastic Agents that hang in "Pending" state

fields.description:
Here https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4903 customer has configured Perforce property using path of visual client which caused Bamboo to run GUI apps in the background.

It would be good to verify that we use path to commandline client.
fields.summary: Validate that configured Perforce capability points to a commandline client

fields.description: Currently when you trigger an existing build from JIRA, the trigger reason does not change and potentially states scheduled or commit by. Instead we should always record the latest trigger reason, in the JIRA case the release trigger reason.
fields.summary: Change trigger reason for Build when Manual stage is continued manually

fields.description: The build details section does not poll for updates if the build is currently queued.
fields.summary: Build Details should poll when build is queued

fields.description: Should be marked as @ExperimentalApi
fields.summary: Add a method for non-file based test collection to the TestCollationService

fields.description:
Take the scenario of three consecutive builds:

1. test A fails
2. compilation failure
3. test A fails

In build #3 test A is marked as a "new failure" because it didn't fail in build #2. However, there weren't any successes between failures.
If you go to the test case history it correctly shows that it has been failing since #1 (or earlier) but it would be nice if the build #3 page also said it was an existing failure. Would make it a bit easier in diagnosing/fixing broken builds.
fields.summary: Improper detection and marking of "new test failure"s

fields.description:
I've set up a fresh JIRA 4.3.4 installation and proceeded with creation of application links on Bamboo side. Creation of Bamboo -> JIRA link went fine, but when I tried to create a reciprocal link in the second step, I got an error message saying that the remote application is not able to connect to my instance. The url to Bamboo instance was correct and so were the credentials to JIRA.
Manual creation of JIRA -> Bamboo link went fine, using the same Bamboo URL.

fields.description:
We are commercial user of Bamboo an we have more than 800 plans.
When administrating the plans is hard to use the page 'All Plans'. I attach a screenshot with the log scroll.
This problem is stoppig us in creating new plans. One alternative is to install a new Bamboo instance, but we lose the central point of management.
fields.summary: All Plans screen in nos usable when more than 800 plans exists. Allow any category or folder organization.

fields.description:
This causes problems when plugin try to update anything else than ResultsSummary. (which is saved explicitely)

Example: AutoFavouritePlugin: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4863, https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4984

We need to make sure that at least AutoFavouritePlugin works.
fields.summary: Call to PostChainAction plugins are not transactional

fields.description: Exposing the data through REST, would allow the reports to be displayed in JIRA Dashboards through gadgets.
fields.summary: Expose the Bamboo Reports data through REST APIs

fields.description:
The source repository is not cloned correctly when the destination plan has a name and key the same as a recently deleted plan.

To reproduce:
1. Create a plan and set the plan source repository
2. Delete this plan
3. Wait... then clone a plan and give it the same name / key as the deleted plan
4. Note that the source repository is that of the deleted plan, not the plan that was cloned.
fields.summary: Stale info when duplicating a plan into a plan with the same key/name as one recently deleted

fields.description:

fields.summary: Freemarker becomes unable to read plugin bean fields when the plugin is reloaded with atlas-cli pi

fields.description:
from [BSP-4899|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4899]

when using git repository containing large files (~130M):
{quote}
rw-rw-r- 1 xx yy 30625792 Jun 23 17:20 Exx110604(1).vsp
rw-rw-r- 1 xx yy 154105406 Jun 23 17:20 Exx110604(2).vsp
{quote}
btw: These were backup/temporary files anyway that should not be in the repo.

when using such large files the git plugin hang up on 'checkout' phase:
{noformat}
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:23 Fetching branch 'refs/heads/feature/BAM-8888'.
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:27 Git: remote: Counting objects
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:34 Git: remote: Compressing objects (5,524)
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:40 Git: Receiving objects (12,416)
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:55 Git: 17% (2,110/12,416)
 23-Jun-2011 11:03:58 Git: Resolving deltas (8,134)
 23-Jun-2011 11:04:04 Git: Total 12416 (delta 8134), reused 10033 (delta 6519)
 23-Jun-2011 11:04:05 Checking out revision a939d3dac3f305a50adb217dc3103298925d1d9e.
 23-Jun-2011 18:14:51 Updated source code to revision: a939d3dac3f305a50adb217dc3103298925d1d9e
{noformat}
Git plugin uses 7 hours to do the checkout.
{quote}
Watching the checkout it seems the first 120M is checked out quickly, then it gets bogged down and is extremely slow. Eventually the checkout will complete and the build starts.
{quote}

User experience:
{quote}
This is quite strange because I would expect the checkout to either pass or fail, not stall/slow down. I'm assuming the git plugin has issues with the () characters in the file names.
{quote}

----

(?) todo: investigate if the problem is caused by large files, or by different reasons
fields.summary: Git Plugin has extremely slow checkouts on big files.

fields.description:
When the agent runs as the system, the param for java.io.tmpdir defaults to *C:\WINDOWS\TEMP\<BUILD-KEY>* and the build works just fine.
When I run the agent as a user (trying to get around permissions issues with writing) the param for java.io.tmpdir defaults to *"C:\Documents and Settings\<user-name>\Local Settings\temp\<BUILD-KEY>"*

When the build runs, the first task that runs an Ant script I get a message that says:
{color:red}
BUILD FAILED
Target "and" does not exist in project "<project-name>"{color}

Even though I see that the param being passed is in quotes so the space in the path should be taken care of, that's the only "and" I can find in my log.  In the build script "and" does not appear anywhere, not even embedded in some other word.
fields.summary: Running a Bamboo Remote Agent service on Windows as a user other than System the parameter passed to the java.io.tmpdir fails the build

fields.description:
We are using Bamboo for Maven releases, we use the Bamboo 3.1 tasks with build plan variables. We have to include the username and password as variables so we can release under end-user credentials. Unfortunately Bamboo displays all the variables of the build plan. Maven correctly hides the password with ***** in the output log but bamboo does not.

As an user I want to provide my credentials as plan variables without them showing up in the bamboo build log and build summary.
fields.summary: Hide password in build variables

fields.description:
Affected version is in fact 3.0.4-studio-3 (which isn't accepted in the Affects Version/s field).

In Studio on Unicorn, we had a situation where Bamboo was failing to reach Elastic Agents via a proxy due to a firewall configuration issue - details here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HPT-334

In this scenario, Bamboo appears to leak sockets, as described here: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5191

fields.description:
Spots instances have been a great money saver but this saving gets absolutely crushed on bamboo crashes and restarts because of the connectivity loss to amazon EC2 agents.  These agents will remain running and continue to charge us money.

We need to allow for us and customers to shut these instances down that "have never connected to this bamboo instance"

Navigate from Administration -> Instances -> You can view all elastic instances that are running on your account


Please see the attachment on all my instances that I get charged because Bamboo does not clean these up on startup/shutdown (another feature I'd like as an optional config setting).
fields.summary: Shutdown all instances that "have never connected to this bamboo instance" feature

fields.description:
Whats happening:
* The OAuth token has expired during a release
* Once the user has done the 3LO dance they are returned to the tab panel
* Tab Panel queries Bamboo, detects that the build has finished (success or failure), releases the jira version

fields.description:
Currently the automatic detection for capabilities happens when the agent is installed only. A restart will not re-detect them.

We need an option in the admin console that would allow the admin to re-trigger the detection.

Currently, a re-detection demands a re-installation of the Agent (with a new Home-Dir)
fields.summary: Add an option to the Admin Console that would allow the Agent capabilities to be detected again

Release Management Plugin should not block on startup

fields.description: With the recent security and critial fixes to Oracle's JDK, for example between updates 24 through 26, we have had a need to use the updated JDK in our builds and have had to force each job to specifically point to "JDK 1.6.0_25".  We had to do this so we didn't break older product builds that were pointing at the default "JDK" or "JDK 1.6".  Of course, with our builds, we have many jobs, over 20 in our plans.  It would be outstanding if we could set the JDK on a per plan basis so that all jobs can inherit from the plan settings.  This could work the exact same way of inheriting the plan's source repository.
fields.summary: Allow the JDK to be set on a per plan basis and allow jobs to override

fields.description:
I just installed 3.1.3 and upgraded from Bamboo 3.0.
I was working on a new script to take advantage of the Task system that was added in the new version.

It happens on an Ant task on the first stage of a build job.

On the Task Configuration dialog on the optional line for Environment Variables I specify a few custom environment variables and I also specify a custom Path variable to accomodate different build environments on different projects.

When I tell the plan to run it fails because some tools can't be found in the path.  In the build log I can see that the "Path" variable has been set twice and it looks like the second time it's being set it's overwriting the custom path data I had specified.
fields.summary: Setting custom PATH on a task for a remote agent, the PATH environment variable is being overwritten when the task launches by the remote agents' own path

fields.description:
see [BSP-4598|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-4598] for details.

When you start a wrapper it says the following.. 
{noformat}
Ajay-Sridhars-MacBook-Pro-2:~ asridhar$ echo $JDK_HOME

Ajay-Sridhars-MacBook-Pro-2:~ asridhar$ echo $JAVA_HOME


Ajay-Sridhars-MacBook-Pro-2:~ asridhar$ cd ~/Downloads/
Ajay-Sridhars-MacBook-Pro-2:Downloads asridhar$ java -jar atlassian-bamboo-agent-installer-3.1.jar http://192.168.15.188:8085/agentServer/
....
JAVA_HOME: /System/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/1.6.0.jdk/Contents/Home
....
{noformat}

It sets the JAVA_HOME... 
-If you try to set the JAVA_HOME='' in your Bamboo plan config, it gets overriden by the agent's JAVA_HOME definition eventhough its not set in build - the customer doesn't want this-
if you set JAVA_HOME in the bamboo config plan it does take effect and it's used. When JAVA_HOME is not set at all then the one set by the remote client takes place in the environment.
fields.summary: Remote Agent Installer overwrites JAVA_HOME envset

fields.description:
If you imagine that your first stage has to build a huge project and uses the Cleanup Build Processor to delete the source code directory afterwards, the next stage is waiting until this task is finished.

If you would invoke that process asynchronous, for example by finalizing the job, send all results to the server and take the remote agent offline while it is doing the cleanup, the next stage could already proceed. For our projects it would decrease the total time by 25%!
fields.summary: Invoke Cleanup Build Processor asynchronous
